meanings.definition: Of or relating to the solstice.
meanings.sent1: The solstitial sun shone brightly on the longest day of the year.
meanings.sent2: The solstitial celebration marked the beginning of summer.
meanings.sent3: The solstitial picnic was filled with sunshine and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as a solstitial hug.
meanings.sent5: The solstitial colors of the sky painted a breathtaking scene at dusk.

meanings.definition: Occurring at or near the time of the solstice.
meanings.sent1: The solstitial flowers bloomed in perfect alignment with the changing season.
meanings.sent2: The solstitial gathering brought people together to honor the changing of the seasons.
meanings.sent3: The solstitial traffic jam was a result of everyone rushing to see the sunset.
meanings.sent4: The solstitial mood in the air hinted at the magic of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The solstitial energy filled the room with anticipation for the upcoming festivities.
